title: Nirvana (Buddhism)
summary: Nirvana (Sanskrit: nirvāṇa; Pali: nibbana, nibbāna) is "blowing out" or "quenching" of the activities of the worldy mind and its related suffering.[1] Nirvana is the goal of the Buddhist path, and marks the soteriological release from worldly suffering and rebirths in saṃsāra.[2][2][3] Nirvana is part of the Third Truth on "cessation of dukkha" in the Four Noble Truths,[2] and the "summum bonum of Buddhism and goal of the Eightfold Path."[3]
